content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: all good.

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Nice story.
Unfortunately, there are no coding skills required to solve that puzzle.
I'm rejecting it because I will learn nothing from it.

One more important thing, you cannot ask for
"A boolean saying if the impostor managed to kill all the crewmates"
because that is language-dependent (if I used c++ in my solution, it would print "true" without capitalizing, which wouldn't pass the test). You have to explicitly say
'print "True" if he managed to kill them all, "False" otherwise'

Simple clash, but I think the last two sentences are confusing. I would add something like:
"If he doesn't manage to kill them all, output the amount of *extra* time he needed. *If he does manage to kill them all*, output the time he spared by killing them sooner. The impostor starts with the cooldown *on/active*" 
[Is there a reason for starting in cooldown mode? It doesn't quite fit the story]

I think you should also mention that the killings are instantaneous!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I appreciate it. Funny and Simple for clash of codes

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very funny
pls give me some feedback in the comments

I thing your might have a wrong understanding of CoC. This is not a programming course.
It's a way, for people to compete, many skills are required, including how fast you can understand and solve a problem.

I'm glad that you confirmed my comments.
What's left is to decide if CoC is:
a) coding skills contest or
b) fast reading skills contest.
:wink:

Let's see the official definition:

What’s this game?

Clash of Code is a game to improve your coding efficiency by solving short programming problems with other people, at the same time. Players share their solution at the end of a game to help other players improve their coding skills.

What’s the purpose?

  ⭐ Improve your problem-solving skills
  ⭐ Learn from other people’s code
  ⭐ Practice coding interview questions
Ok, After checking your CG profile, I can do nothing beside retrieving my initial comment, and follow your path by rejecting this as well.

I'm confused, Snake_Tn. You criticized elderlybeginner's comment; then immediately apologized and promised that you would reject the contribution when you discovered they're top rank; you did reject the contribution; then changed it into an approval the day after. That looks a bit questionable to me.
